decks.notes: The main concept of this UR Aggro deck in Modern 1 vs 1 is to quickly deploy low-cost threats like Young Pyromancer, Monastery Swiftspear, and Delver of Secrets while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Mana Leak and Remand. The deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt, while also generating card advantage and digging for more threats with cards like Serum Visions and Treasure Cruise. The deck's game plan revolves around proactive aggression and resource management to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Jeskai Ascendancy combo by using cantrips to dig through the deck, generating mana to cast spells and untap creatures to continue the combo loop. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Remand. The win condition is to create a large creature through the combo and swing in for lethal damage. The deck is designed to be powerful and efficient in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

The Jeskai Ascendancy combo deck focuses on assembling the namesake enchantment along with various zero-mana cantrips and mana creatures to generate a repeating loop of spell casts, triggering Ascendancy's untap ability and pump effect to generate infinite mana and make creatures infinitely large. The deck also includes Glittering Wish to tutor for key combo pieces from the sideboard, and relies on Faithless Looting and Treasure Cruise for card draw and selection to help find the combo pieces quickly while protecting the combo with Pact of Negation and Slaughter Pact.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful combo with Jeskai Ascendancy to generate mana and draw cards while untapping creatures like Fatestitcher. By cycling through the deck quickly with cards like Gitaxian Probe and Serum Visions, the goal is to find the Ascendancy and necessary spells to win the game in a single explosive turn. The deck also includes control elements like Remand, Path to Exile, and Lightning Bolt to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up the combo.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on disruptive hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's game plan while utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, and Scavenging Ooze to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Dismember to deal with threats on the board, as well as planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for additional value. The deck aims to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with strong creatures to secure victory.

The deck focuses on playing cheap, efficient creatures and spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently. It uses cards like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Young Pyromancer to apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes a lot of card draw and filtering spells like Serum Visions, Gitaxian Probe, and Thought Scour to keep the hand full of threats. The interaction spells like Lightning Bolt, Vapor Snag, and Mana Leak help to control the board and protect the creatures. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with fast, aggressive plays.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently control the board with low-cost spells and disruptive creatures, while quickly filling the graveyard to fuel card draw with Treasure Cruise. Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Tarmogoyf provide aggressive early threats, while Snapcaster Mage and a suite of counterspells help maintain the tempo advantage. The deck aims to consistently apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of burn spells, efficient creatures, and card advantage.

The deck focuses on combining aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Monastery Swiftspear with efficient instants and sorceries to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw spells like Serum Visions and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the red and blue spells in the deck with fetch lands and shock lands. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with varying abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy and establish a dominant board presence. By utilizing cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling, the deck can tutor for specific creatures that serve different purposes, such as removal, lifegain, or creature recursion. The deck aims to control the game through its versatile creatures while also building up its battlefield presence with cards like Gavony Township. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by leveraging its toolbox of creatures effectively.

This deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to tutor up various creatures to create powerful board states and combos. It utilizes a toolbox approach, with a variety of creatures that provide different abilities and synergies. The deck includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay to help control the game while setting up its combos. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Siege Rhino and Restoration Angel, combined with efficient mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, allows the deck to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield.

The main concept of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt, supported by aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck aims to control the board with creatures and burn spells while applying pressure to the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack pushes the deck's overall strategy of dealing fast and consistent damage while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Jeskai Ascendancy along with Fatestitcher to generate a powerful combo that allows for infinite mana, card draw, and creature untapping. The deck aims to quickly cycle through cards with cantrips like Serum Visions and Gitaxian Probe, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt. Dig Through Time is used to dig for combo pieces and other key spells, while Remand provides tempo advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling the combo as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent and overwhelming them with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to win the game as fast as possible by combining efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide with powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck also includes cards like Treasure Cruise to refill its hand and keep up the pressure. The goal is to end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

The deck focuses on quickly outpacing the opponent with low-cost, efficient spells and creatures while utilizing card draw and manipulation to maintain momentum. It aims to apply pressure early on with a mix of small, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Young Pyromancer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Mana Leak and Remand. The inclusion of cards like Treasure Cruise and Serum Visions allow the deck to refill its hand and dig for key cards, ensuring a steady stream of threats and answers throughout the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan while using card draw and tempo plays to maintain pressure and stay ahead. With a mix of aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Monastery Swiftspear, along with efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Vapor Snag, this UR Aggro deck aims to apply pressure early and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Treasure Cruise helps to refuel the hand and keep the aggression going, while cards like Remand and Spell Pierce provide disruption to slow down the opponent's plans.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly generate a large amount of mana through rituals and card draw, while utilizing Pyromancer Ascension to duplicate spells and generate huge amounts of storm count. The goal is to cast a lethal Grapeshot or generate enough mana to flashback Past in Flames and cast multiple spells in the same turn to finish off the opponent. The deck relies on quickly cycling through its library and setting up explosive turns to overwhelm the opponent before they can respond.

The deck focuses on using cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Goblin Electromancer to generate mana and draw cards in order to set up for a powerful combo turn where the player can chain together multiple spells like rituals, cantrips, and storm spells to generate a large storm count and finish the game with a lethal Grapeshot or by recasting spells with Past in Flames. The deck aims to win quickly and explosively by efficiently sequencing spells and using card selection to find the pieces needed to assemble the combo.

The deck relies on utilizing Birthing Pod to search for and play creatures that have various abilities to control the board and gain incremental advantages. The combination of creatures in the deck allows for flexibility in dealing with various threats and creating powerful synergies. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy and allow for smooth and consistent gameplay. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this Scapeshift control deck is to control the board with counterspells and burn spells while ramping up mana with cards like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder. The goal is to eventually play Scapeshift to sacrifice lands and deal lethal damage with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle triggers. The deck focuses on efficient removal and card advantage through cards like Cryptic Command and Dig Through Time, while also utilizing Snapcaster Mage to recycle key spells. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents while setting up a game-winning Scapeshift combo.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells, while ramping up mana with search spells like Search for Tomorrow and ramp creatures like Sakura-Tribe Elder. The main win condition involves playing Scapeshift to sacrifice lands and find Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle, dealing damage to the opponent with mountains entering the battlefield. The deck also includes card draw and flexibility with Snapcaster Mage and Dig Through Time, to ensure consistency and adaptability to different game situations.

The focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana and card advantage to set up a powerful chain of spells that culminate in a lethal Grapeshot or Past in Flames combo. By efficiently cycling through the deck with cards like Thought Scour, Serum Visions, and Gitaxian Probe, the deck aims to find the necessary combo pieces while utilizing Pyromancer Ascension and Goblin Electromancer to further accelerate its game plan. With careful sequencing and resource management, the deck can overwhelm opponents with its explosive storm mechanics.

The UW Control deck focuses on managing the opponent's threats through countering spells, removal, and card draw. It aims to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy, while also using versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Restoration Angel to provide additional value. The deck includes a mix of instant speed removal, counterspells, and card advantage spells to maintain control of the game. The mana base is designed to allow for consistent access to the deck's powerful spells and to provide flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play Scapeshift, which allows the player to sacrifice lands to search for and put into play a number of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains, dealing damage to the opponent. Control elements like counterspells and removal spells help protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and deck manipulation to help find the key pieces needed for the combo. Strong synergy between ramp, control, and win condition make this deck a powerful contender in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on casting cheap spells, drawing cards, and creating early pressure on the opponent. By utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Delver of Secrets along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt, the deck aims to quickly whittle down the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cantrips like Serum Visions and Gitaxian Probe helps to cycle through the deck and find key pieces. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by flashing back spells from the graveyard. The mana base is set up to consistently cast red and blue spells while utilizing fetch lands for deck thinning.
